net.proteusframework.users.capability

Class AbstractEntityCapability<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.users.capability.AbstractCapability
      • net.proteusframework.users.capability.AbstractDataCapability
        • net.proteusframework.users.capability.AbstractEntityCapability<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The object type of the Subject (the thing being protected). This must be a hibernate entity.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Entity<Long>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    PrincipalGroupCapability

    @Entity
public abstract class AbstractEntityCapability<T>
extends AbstractDataCapability
    Abstract class for defining a data capability whose subject is an entity. Implementors should follow the naming conventions described below, as generic processor DAOs make assumptions about the subject entities based on them. The naming convention for children classes is to use the subject's class name followed by "Capability". For example, the data capability where the subject is a PrincipalGroup is PrincipalGroupCapability.
    Author:
    Greg Dick (gdick@i2rd.com), Ben Barber (bbarber@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
